stimulusHtml: A researcher discovered a chemical compound that seems to slow down the heart rate of monkeys by targeting an area of the medulla. The researcher believes that the compound could help reduce the symptoms associated with panic disorder. Which of the following is the appropriate next step for the researcher to take after developing the compound into a new drug?
choicesHtml: Immediately begin giving the drug to humans to test its effects.
Publish the findings in an appropriate journal and see if the results can be replicated.
Report the findings to a reputable pharmaceutical company to apply for a patent.
Apply to an institutional review board (IRB) to begin animal trials for the drug.
